message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.CL. 

The paper proposes a new method for sequential learning in artificial neural networks, specifically addressing the problem of catastrophic forgetting. This falls under the broad category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The method involves adding task-dependent memory units, which suggests a focus on neural networks (cs.NE) and computer vision (cs.CV) tasks. The experiments are conducted on variants of the MNIST, CIFAR-10, and CIFAR-100 datasets, which are commonly used in computer vision tasks. Additionally, the paper mentions using adversarial examples, which is a topic in natural language processing (cs.CL). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV, and cs.CL, in that order.
